title: How to cite APA in text with multiple authors - Quora

response.answer_text: There are two approaches for in-text citations - parenthetical and nonparenthetical. Here are examples for both with multiple authors: According to Jones and Smith (2020), the world is round.The world is round (Jones & Smith, 2020).There are some variants to the above, depending on the number of authors. For the full set of rules, see Reference List: Author/Authors // Purdue Writing Lab (note that the rules were recently modified for 7th Edition, which is currently in effect)

If you have two authors you would cite it in this manner: Stephens & Lewis (2014) state that … However, if there are more than two authors, like this (Lewis et al, 2014). If citing two articles (sources by multiple authors, like this: Lewis et al, 2014: Stephens & Lewis, 2014), concur regarding the rising population growth….
